definitions.definition: : A summary of a person's or organization's assets, liabilities and equity as of a specific date.
A stick used to play drums.
The second joint of the legbone of a chicken or other fowl, especially as an item of food.
The moringa or drumstick tree, Moringa oleifera, especially its slender, cylindrical pods.
To take apart from; to take off.
definitions.example: to detach the tag from a newly purchased garment

definitions.definition: To separate for a special object or use.
definitions.example: to detach a ship from a fleet, or a company from a regiment

definitions.definition: To come off something.
definitions.example: Now that the zipper has detached, my winter coat won't keep me very warm.

definitions.definition: Not physically attached; separated from something it could connect to.
Of a house: not joined to another house on either side.
Having or showing no bias or emotional involvement; disinterested.
Not influenced by anyone else; characterized by an impersonal objectivity; impartial.
A family of theories and methods within the field of psychotherapy that work to find connections among patients' unconscious mental processes
To make a living; earn money for necessities.
definitions.example: It is difficult to provide for my family working on minimum wage.

definitions.definition: To act to prepare for something.
definitions.example: Provide against disaster.

definitions.definition: To establish as a previous condition; to stipulate.
definitions.example: I'll lend you the money, provided that you pay it back by Monday.

definitions.definition: To give what is needed or desired, especially basic needs.
definitions.example: Don't bother bringing equipment, as we will provide it.

definitions.definition: To furnish (with), cause to be present.
To make possible or attainable.
definitions.example: He provides us with an alternative option.

definitions.definition: (Latinism) To foresee.
To appoint to an ecclesiastical benefice before it is vacant. See provisor.
Something provided; a provision.
A computer or video game of the genre characterized by investigation, exploration, puzzle-solving, interaction with game characters, and a focus on narrative rather than reflex-based challenges.
A dwelling detached from a primary residence, traditionally designated for a member of an extended family to live in.
A building or site open to the public for fitness and sporting activities.
A trajectory, the traveled path of a projectile, rocket or aircraft through the air.
An airway, the predefined route of travel for an aircraft or spacecraft.
Mentha spicata, A herb of the mint family, commonly used in herb tea, candy and to treat mild stomach ache.
To act as someone's mentor
An arrangement by which one person mentors another.
A slapstick performance artist often associated with a circus and usually characterized by bright, oversized clothing, a red nose, face paint, and a brightly colored wig.
A person who acts in a silly fashion.
A stupid person.
A man of coarse nature and manners; an awkward fellow; an illbred person; a boor.
One who works upon the soil; a rustic; a churl; a yokel.
To act in a silly or playful fashion.
To ridicule.
Elegant, smart or stylish.
Fond of dressing up; keen on fashion.
The direct rays, light or warmth of the sun.
definitions.example: We were warmed by the bright sunshine.

definitions.definition: A location on which the sun's rays fall.
definitions.example: We moved out of the shade and into the sunshine.

definitions.definition: Geniality or cheerfulness.
definitions.example: I enjoyed the sunshine of her smile.

definitions.definition: A source of cheerfulness or joy.
The effect which the sun has when it lights and warms some place.
Friendly form of address often reserved for juniors.
definitions.example: Alright sunshine, safe to cross now.

definitions.definition: Ironic form of address used to an inferior or troublemaker.
definitions.example: OK, sunshine, listen up and listen good. There's five vandalised telephone boxes out there and I know you're responsible.

definitions.definition: Used to address someone who has just woken up and/or is very sleepy.
definitions.example: Good morning, sunshine!

definitions.definition: Open to and permitting public access, especially with regard to activities that were previously closed-door or back-room meetings.
definitions.example: Because of the sunshine law, we could go to the planning meeting.

definitions.definition: An inhabitant, resident, or person of descent from Greece.

Unintelligible speech or text, such as foreign speech or text, or regarding subjects the listener is not familiar with, such as mathematics or technical jargon; or statements that the listener does not understand or agree with.
A member of a college fraternity or sorority, which are characterised by being named after Greek letters. (See also Greek system.)
definitions.example: Was Joe a Greek in college?

definitions.definition: A cunning rogue; a merry fellow.
Anal sex.
Greek cuisine; traditional Greek food.
(chiefly in the plural) One of the Greeks, measures of derivative price sensitivity.
To display a placeholder (instead of text), especially to optimize speed in displaying text that would be too small to read.
To fill a template with nonsense text (particularly the Lorem ipsum), so that form can be focused on instead of content.
A nanoparticle formed by the degradation of a plastic.
The act of finding exceedingly small differences which are probably neither important nor noticeable to most people.
Strange, similar to the effects of a hallucinogen.
An epilogue.
(of a letter) a postscript.
(to a book) an appendix.
Any of several plant-eating marine mammals, of family Trichechidae, found in tropical regions.
A bitter brownish-yellow or greenish-yellow secretion produced by the liver, stored in the gall bladder, and discharged into the duodenum where it aids the process of digestion.
Bitterness of temper; ill humour; irascibility.
Two of the four humours, black bile or yellow bile, in ancient and medieval physiology.
A boil (kind of swelling).
(of liquids) To heat to the point where it begins to turn into a gas.
definitions.example: Boil some water in a pan.

definitions.definition: To cook in boiling water.
definitions.example: Boil the eggs for three minutes.

definitions.definition: (of liquids) To begin to turn into a gas, seethe.
definitions.example: Pure water boils at 100 degrees Celsius.

definitions.definition: To bring to a boil, to heat so as to cause the contents to boil.
(used only in progressive tenses, of weather) To be uncomfortably hot.
definitions.example: It’s boiling outside!

definitions.definition: (used only in progressive tenses) To feel uncomfortably hot.
definitions.example: I’m boiling in here – could you open the window?

definitions.definition: To form, or separate, by boiling or evaporation.
definitions.example: to boil sugar or salt

definitions.definition: To steep or soak in warm water.
To be agitated like boiling water; to bubble; to effervesce.
definitions.example: the boiling waves of the sea

definitions.definition: To be moved or excited with passion; to be hot or fervid.
definitions.example: His blood boils with anger.

definitions.definition: Permitted.
Beautiful.
To astonish, bewilder or dazzle.
Stunned; astounded; astonished.
Idiotic.
An execution by being nailed or tied to an upright cross and left to hang there until dead.
definitions.example: Rome used crucifixions as a deterrent, and standard for the 'vilest' crimes, such as slave rebellion.

definitions.definition: The military punishment of being tied to a fixed object, often with the limbs in a stretched position.
An ordeal, terrible, especially malicious treatment imposed upon someone.
definitions.example: The suspects' hostile interrogation amounted to a public crucifixion.

definitions.definition: The act of swimming underwater without a diving suit.
Brown as a ripe and dried nut.
(games) A game, played on a device with a sloping base, in which the player operates a spring-loaded plunger to shoot a ball, between obstacles, and attempts to hit targets and score points.
The ball used in pinball.
A situation where a ball is frantically kicked between many players.
To dart about rapidly.
A pile, a group of people or things which have piled up on one another, especially
An accumulation that occurs over time, especially one which is not welcome.
A color, or shade of color; tint; dye.
The characteristic related to the light frequency that appears in the color, for instance red, yellow, green, cyan, blue or magenta.
definitions.example: In digital arts, HSV color uses hue together with saturation and value.

definitions.definition: A character; aspect.
Form; appearance; guise.
A shout or cry.
A lodging for pilgrims or the destitute, normally provided by a monastic order.

The provision of palliative care for terminally ill patients, either at a specialized facility or at a residence, and support for the family, typically refraining from taking extraordinary measures to prolong life.
A specialized facility or organization offering palliative care for the terminally ill.
Any of several plants, of the genus Jasminum, mostly native to Asia, having fragrant white or yellow flowers.
The perfume obtained from these plants.
Any of several unrelated plants having a similar perfume.
A yellow colour.
According to or using mathematics.
definitions.example: It is mathematically impossible to divide by zero.

definitions.definition: To receive a sunburn.
To burn or tan (someone's skin) by the sun; to allow (a part of one's body) to become sunburnt.
(of human skin) Having a sunburn or dark tan; having been burned by the sun's rays.
(of plants and other objects) Dried by the sun's rays.
(of places or objects) Subject to the strong heat and/or light of the sun.
Resembling a sunburn in color.
definitions.example: The van was painted a sunburnt brown.

definitions.definition: A runway for aircraft, especially one which is auxiliary or temporary.
A cultivated pubic hair pattern in which much of the pubic hair is removed, leaving only a central vertical line or rectangle.
A prison with the highest possible level of security.
Being, or pertaining to, such a prison.
A shivering tremor, often from fear or horror.
A moment of almost pleasurable fear; a frisson.
To shake nervously, often from fear or horror.
To vibrate jerkily.
A short interruption in a journey or the place visited during such an interruption.
A pain or ache in a tooth.
Of, relating to, produced by, or coming from the atmosphere.
Translucent or hazy.
Evoking a particular emotional or aesthetic quality.
definitions.example: a dark atmospheric thriller

definitions.definition: An organ formed of the mammary glands of female quadruped mammals, particularly ruminants such as cattle, goats, sheep and deer.
(impolite) A woman's breast.
One who manufactures automobiles; typically used to refer to a large corporation such as General Motors.
A bricklayer, one whose occupation is to build with stone or brick
One who prepares stone for building purposes.
A member of the fraternity of Freemasons. See Freemason.
(normally with a preposition) To build stonework or brickwork about, under, in, over, etc.; to construct by masons
definitions.example: to mason in a kettle or boiler

definitions.definition: A species of baleen whale (Megaptera novaeangliae).
A public declaration of principles, policies, or intentions, especially that of a political party.
definitions.example: A creed is a manifesto of religious or spiritual beliefs.

definitions.definition: To issue a manifesto
Anything surgically implanted in the body, such as a tissue graft or prosthesis, particularly breast implants.
(travel) A representative of a travel company, working within the office of a large client and exclusively dealing with that client.
To fix firmly or set securely or deeply.
To insert (something) surgically into the body.
Of an embryo, to become attached to and embedded in the womb.
A person trained to handle a dog, especially a police dog or a K-9 unit in the military
A faqir, owning no personal property and usually living solely off alms.
(Hindu) An ascetic mendicant, especially one who performs feats of endurance or apparent magic.
Someone who takes advantage of the gullible through fakery, especially of a spiritual or religious nature.
A medal made of, or having the colour of, silver, given as a prize for finishing in second place
(by extension) Finishing in second position, being a runner-up
Awareness.
Inclination to be mindful or aware.
(as understood in Buddhism and psychology) Paying attention on purpose, in the present moment, and non-judgementally.
A form of secular meditation practice with roots in Buddhist meditation.
To defraud someone by giving them less change than they should be given after a transaction.
definitions.example: I got shortchanged! …I gave him $10 for a $5 item and he only gave me $1 back.

definitions.definition: (by extension) To deprive someone of something for which they paid.
definitions.example: The elective class was easy, but in the end I was shortchanging myself.

definitions.definition: To make disadvantaged by design.
definitions.example: Being proud of mistreating shortchanged "enemies" is a likely sign of class consciousness, as well as thinking or speaking ill of them.

definitions.definition: A traditional bread eaten by Ashkenazi Jews, usually braided for the Sabbath and round for Yom Tov.
The commandment to separate a portion of bread or bread dough for the cohanim (Numbers 15:17–21); in contemporary practice, the portion is burned until inedible.
The portion separated in fulfillment of the above.
A battle (or a duel) using small arms.
To engage in battle using small arms.
A folktale featuring fairies or similar fantasy characters.
definitions.example: I used to love reading fairy tales when I was a child.

definitions.definition: A story presented as true that is not believable.
definitions.example: He's telling us another fairy tale about how great the software will be.

definitions.definition: A medical condition in which the capacity of the blood to transport oxygen to the tissues is reduced, either because of too few red blood cells, or because of too little hemoglobin, resulting in pallor and fatigue.
A disease or condition that has anemia as a symptom.
definitions.example: Pernicious anemia and sickle-cell anemia are two anemias.

definitions.definition: (obsolete) Ischemia.
Set of rules generally regarded and accepted as binding in relations between states and between nations, serving as a framework for the practice of stable and organized international relations.
Having a common center.

(of a motion) in the direction of contraction of a muscle. (E.g. extension of the lower arm via the elbow joint while contracting the triceps and other elbow extensor muscles; closing of the jaw while flexing the masseter).
An unknown or hard-to-define influence; a factor with unknown or unforeseeable consequences.
A special talent, ability or quality or its indefinable cause.
Prothrombinase, also called factor X.
The proportionality constant which converts CO emission line brightness to molecular hydrogen mass.
The doctrine of the oneness and unity of reality, despite the appearance of diversity in the world.
To pass laws (including the amending or repeal of existing laws).
Punctual or according to schedule.
Punctually or according to the schedule.
definitions.example: The train arrived on time for the first time this week.

definitions.definition: By installments, payments over a period of time.
definitions.example: They bought their dining-room furniture on time.

definitions.definition: By a player's running out of time.
definitions.example: Smith beat Jones on time.

definitions.definition: A gathering of theatrical performers for the purpose of being photographed.
A session in which a posed celebrity is photographed.
(Namibia) A pick-up truck or ute, generally open, possibly fitted with a removable canopy or similar accessories, but distinct from a large truck and from a van or similar small utility vehicle.
A covered small bowl, such as a Tupperware container.
The administration of a medication etc, in a measured amount; dosing.
The addition of a small measured amount of a substance to something, e.g. sugar to wine.
The measured amount so administered or added; the dose.
Well-established and tested; known to work or succeed based on extensive experience.
definitions.example: He liked to stick to tried and true methods in his garden.

definitions.definition: A person or thing that converts.
A patient with a certain condition that subsequently develops into another condition.
A retort, used in the Bessemer process, in which molten cast iron is decarburized and converted into steel by a blast of air forced through the liquid metal.
To tire excessively.
To become excessively tired.
Overly tired
To bring about the catalysis of a chemical reaction.
To accelerate a process.
To inspire significantly by catalysis.
A tract of land in which the dead are buried.
(by extension) A final storage place for collections of things that are no longer useful or useable.
In an obvious or clearly apparent manner.
definitions.example: She was in floods of tears and obviously very upset.

definitions.definition: Used as a filler word, or to introduce information even when not obvious.
definitions.example: You weren't to know, but I've spoken to, obviously, Jim about this, and ...

definitions.definition: A kick made by dropping the ball on the ground and kicking it as it bounces up.
An insignificant, contemptible or unfashionable person; a loser; used as a general insult.
To drop (a ball) and kick it after it hits the ground.
To make adjustments (to an engine or bicycle drivetrain) in order to improve its performance.
To make preparations for vigorous exercise; to warm up.
To begin to sing or play music.
To beat up (someone).
An area on a ship's deck or on the roof of a house used for sunbathing.
Aggressively ambitious; overly assertive, bold or determined.
definitions.example: Parents are ruining school sports days by being pushy and overbearing, a survey suggests. BBC

definitions.definition: A set-piece where the ball is thrown back into play

A throw of the ball back into play by the boundary umpire. The umpire faces away from the players and throws it in over his or her shoulder (so as to clearly not favour either side by where exactly it's thrown).
The start time of a Gaelic football match, comparable to kick off in other games.
An extra item added free of charge; a product that is thrown in with another.

A financial agreement under which a bank or other lender agrees to provide a client with loans of money up to an approved limit during a predefined period. The client may borrow the entire credit amount all at once or in portions during the specified period.
The maximum borrowable amount specified in such an agreement.
A staff with a hooked end similar to a shepherd's crook, or with a cross at the end, carried by an abbot, bishop, or archbishop as a symbol of office.
A young fern frond, before it has unrolled; fiddlehead
The state of being a mother; motherhood.
The state of being pregnant; pregnancy.
A ward or department in a hospital in which babies are born.
A marine mammal of any of several genera in the family Otariidae (the eared seals).
A monster consisting of the upper part of a lion combined with the tail of a fish.
To intrude on a conversation with disingenuous questions in an attempt to engage in unwanted debate as a form of harassment.
To become warmer.
definitions.example: He came inside to warm up.

definitions.definition: To heat or reheat (e.g. food).
definitions.example: I couldn't be bothered to cook another meal so I just warmed up yesterday's leftovers.

definitions.definition: To reach, or cause to reach, a normal operating temperature (of a car for example).
definitions.example: These old valve radios take a few minutes to warm up.

definitions.definition: To do gentle exercise, stretching etc., in order to prepare the body for more vigorous exercise.
definitions.example: It is important to warm up properly before your gym session.

definitions.definition: To prepare for an activity by carrying out a practice or preparation routine.
definitions.example: The band were already on stage, warming up for the gig.

definitions.definition: To make (an audience) enthusiastic or animated before a show
definitions.example: Rich knew how to warm up the audience of The Price is Right. His good looks and charming personality made even that special.

definitions.definition: A woman who engages in sports; a female athlete.
A high collar covering the neck; a turtleneck.
A light type of shirt with such a collar; a turtleneck.
A divinely ordained command, especially one of the Ten Commandments.
Something that must be obeyed; a command or edict.
The act of commanding; exercise of authority.
The offence of commanding or inducing another to violate the law.
An avalanche of snow
